intro: Anemone nemorosa var. quinquefolia, commonly known as the five-leafed wood anemone, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It features delicate, white or pale pink flowers with five petals, typically blooming in early spring. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive, fern-like appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded woodland environments and is often found in forest understories. The species is known for its early flowering and is considered an indicator plant of undisturbed, nutrient-rich soils.
